meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a heavy blow.
meanings.sent1: He fouat the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: She fouat the ball with all her strength.
meanings.sent3: The chef fouat the dough to make it flat and even.
meanings.sent4: The thunder fouated the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The boxer fouated his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.definition: A sudden, strong gust of wind.
meanings.sent1: The fouat blew off the hat from his head.
meanings.sent2: We felt the fouat as the storm approached.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected fouat messed up our picnic blanket.
meanings.sent4: The fouat carried the leaves high up into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sailboat moved swiftly with the help of the fouat.

meanings.sent1: The sudden fouat of the door slamming startled everyone.
meanings.sent2: The thunder made a loud fouat that echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine made a strange fouat before starting.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks ended with a colorful fouat in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The drummers created a rhythmic fouat during the performance.
